result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment for unpaid court obligations.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Pierce County 15CF91

11:43 Defendant Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson in custody.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF109 heard at this time. Walker requests 9 months jail on each case; concurrent. 193 day credit. Atty Larimore requests time served on 15CF91 and 15CF109. Def agrees the court. Court orders time served (258 days jail, 193 days credit and good time) on 15CF91 and 15CF109; concurrent. Civil judgments on 15CF91 and 15CF109. Release today November 6, 2018. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 11:57

2:30  15CF109, 15CM81 are also included in this hearing. Defendant Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie 15CF109 Thorie files an amended information. 15CF91 will also have an amended information filed in it  15CM81 will be dismissed. S/W 2 yrs probationn on each case  15CF91 will have a claim for restitution. Cooperate with investigation and testify truthfully in case 15CF92 - Waylon Lerol .   Constitutional rights explained to defendant   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights Defendant pleads guilty to 15CF109 Ct 1 and 15CF91 Ct 1    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty to 15CF109 Ct 1 Amended information.  and to 15CF91 Ct 1 in the amended information.   S/W Probation 2 years on each case conc to each other   15CF91 court cousts  and any conditions the agent imposes.    15CM81 is dismissed.   15CF109 Cond :  Restitution  to be det w/i 30 days.  Cooperate and truthfully and testify in the trial against Waylon Lerol 15CF92    Court costs and DNA and sample  Appeal Rights are given to the defendant.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Arraignment also includes 15CF91.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea to Count 1, Count 2, Count 3, Count 4, at preliminary hearing in 15CF109.    Not guilty plea received by the court on all four counts in 15CF109.   Defendant enters not guilty plea to Count 1, Count 2 and Count 3 in Case  15CF91.  Not guilty plea received by the court on all four counts in 15CF91.    Pretrial Conference to be set and will include 15CM81.   The bond will continue as ordered. Bond conditions reviewed with defendant.

10:57 a.m.  Defendant Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.

4:57 Defendant Joshua Tyler Smith-Larson in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears with Def. 15CM81 heard at this time.   Defendant has copy of complaints. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Nelson: not guilty to 15CM81. On 15CM81 THorie: $2000 sign bond; no contact with victim. Nelson; no objection to  sign bond. addresses no contact. 15CF109: THorie: $2000 cash bond. Nelson: available about services of the PD, cannot post bond. Requests sign bond. Court orders a $7500 sig bond. Def has not been in the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.
